description.narrative: The IPO is the first step of a new development and investment phase for the Company, which is expected to (i) allow the connection of additional customers to the grid; (ii) reduce technical and commercial distribution losses; (iii) improve the quality of services to end users; (iv) through the improvement of distribution network, contribute to mitigate climate change impacts; As such, this Project represents an important next step in ensuring the long-term reach and reliability of electricity supply in the country.

The proposed transaction is an equity participation by IFC in the IPO of Umeme Limited (Umeme, or the Company), a Ugandan electricity distribution company. Umeme holds a concession for electricity distribution in Uganda until 2025 and the company is presently approximately 98% indirectly owned by Actis Infrastructure 2 LP (AI2), an investment fund under the management of Actis LLP, UK-based emerging market Private Equity firm. The IPO consists of the sale of existing shares and subscription of new shares in Umeme.
